Hi all - have a noob question - I have been searching the wiki page, ksp guide in the ksp game, and other sites and cannot find the answer.

On the launch window, the altimeter toolbar their are two lights - a triangle pointing down (top of the grey toolbar) and a circle (bottom of the grey tool bar).

What are they? (I copied an image from google) (In this image the triangle light is "ON")

Thanks!

The circular light warns you if you are falling faster than 10 m/s. Slightly useful for airplanes.

The triangular light tells you many things in different colors. Whether you are in atmosphere, whether you are in space, whether you are landed, whether you can recover the vessel.

The triangular light actually indicates what sort of recoverable state you are in. If it's blue, you can return to the space center. If it's green, you can recover the vessel. If it's orange-ish, then you're usually close to being able to leave the vessel, but it might still be moving a bit. If it's unlit, then you can't leave (but might be able to revert).
Been at this since .24, I had no idea... (triangle, I knew about the round one)

WOW! awesome! thanks guys!

I'm getting others into the game and they asked me this too - which inspired me to look for the information. Do you know where this info is written down?
